result.execSummary:
The defendant William G Antonelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment  recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Fine ($1,179) is to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 06-12-2015.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County if they are willing to accept defendant.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

DNA surcharge ($200) and Blood draw fee ($24) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant William G Antonelli in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 4.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  33 Months.
Initial Confinement: 15 Months
Extended Supervision:  18 Months   
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 2.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Not to drive a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  





Count 4:
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including medical treatment and counseling).
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on:  06/12/15.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County if they are willing to accept him.
Concurrent to: Count 1.

FINE: $ 1,179
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation on count 1.

15 Months D/L REVOCATION

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Treatment letter filed.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: February 23, 2015
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
